ai.summary: A 6.7 km moderate-paced hike along Eskeradooey Public Right of Way in the UK. This countryside walk follows a public footpath through varied terrain and offers rural scenery, hedgerows, and gentle elevation, with several gates and stiles.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including grassy field edges, compact country paths, minor road sections, and occasional muddy patches. Expect uneven ground, occasional gates and stiles, and hedgerows that may shade parts of the route. Suitable for walkers with moderate fitness.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and wear sturdy footwear. Stay on the public right of way and follow any posted signs. Keep dogs under control and be mindful of livestock. Watch for gates and stiles, and take care on muddy or uneven sections. Plan your start and finish so you have daylight; bring a map or GPS and a charged phone.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish or low light)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are usually the best seasons for this route; it is walkable year-round but can be muddy and darker in winter.
